intro: Diphyes dichilus, commonly known as the African ironwood, is a small, evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its dense, hard wood and its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are typically elliptical in shape. It produces small, white flowers that are clustered in terminal panicles, followed by small, round fruits. The botanical features of Diphyes dichilus make it an important species in both ecological and traditional contexts.
